vectorData.altText: Specialized fibres are present within this layer, what are they?
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That's right! Purkinje fibres, part of the conducting system of the heart, are within the subendocardial layer.

Luminal surface of the ventricular wall showing the layers of the endocardium:
1) the endothelium (En)
2) the thin myoelastic layer (not labeled) 
3) the subendocardial layer (SEn).
In the subendocardial layer are found Purkinje fibres (P) of the conducting system of the heart. Purkinje fibres are specialized cardiac muscle fibres, joined by intercalated discs, that function in impulse conduction rather than contraction.
Deep to the endocardium is the myocardium (M).
FYI: hematoxylin and eosin, a common combination of stains used in tissue preparation for light microscopy.
